awd_titl_txt: High Precision Landau Quantum Oscillation Measurements in   the Normal and Mixed States of High-Temperature             Superconductors
awd_abstract_narration: This is a joint effort (involving LSU, UT and ORNL) to study                  intrinsic, normal-state electronic properties of materials that                 form high-temperature superconductors.  Measurements will be made               of Landau quantum oscillations in both the normal (n) and                       superconducting (sc) mixed states .  The physics studied includes               Fermi-surface topologies, effective masses and scattering rates for             electrons in the n state; the interaction of n electrons with flux              vortices in the mixed state; and superconductivity in the presence              of a strongly Landau-quantized, n-state background.                                                                                                                                         %  %  %                                                                                                                               The measurements are expected to furnish unique data that will                lead to a better understanding of the precise nature of high-                   temperature superconductivity.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
